and went away. He felt sad and de- pressed. It was all so strange, so unlike what he had hoped. 
"Who are they? Why are they here? What do they want? And when will all this end?" thought Rostc'w, looking at the changing shad- ows before him. The pain in his arm became more and more intense. Irresistible drowsiness overpowered him, red rings danced before his eyes, and the impression of those voices and faces and a sense of loneliness merged with the
